[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Deserialization Attack] Can an attacker send maliciously crafted JSON with extremely large nested objects in the `params` BTreeMap during deserialization, causing memory exhaustion and DoS on telemetry ingestion endpoints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Resource Exhaustion] Does the `params: BTreeMap<String, String>` field have size limits, or can an attacker submit millions of key-value pairs causing OOM conditions on validator nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Injection Attack] Can the `name` field contain SQL/NoSQL injection payloads that bypass sanitization when inserted into BigQuery, potentially allowing unauthorized data access or modification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [String Length Attack] Is there validation on the `name` String length, or can an attacker provide arbitrarily long event names (e.g., gigabyte-sized strings) causing memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Path Traversal] Can the `name` field contain path traversal sequences (../../etc/passwd) that could be exploited if the event name is used in file system operations downstream? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Command Injection] Does the `name` field properly sanitize shell metacharacters that could be exploited if event names are passed to system commands in logging or monitoring systems? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [XSS Attack] Can the `name` or `params` values contain XSS payloads (<script>alert(1)</script>) that execute when telemetry data is displayed in monitoring dashboards? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Unicode Normalization] Are Unicode homograph attacks possible in the `name` field, where visually identical characters with different encodings bypass filtering or cause confusion in event identification? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Hash Collision] Does the BTreeMap implementation for `params` properly handle hash collision attacks where an attacker provides keys designed to cause worst-case O(nÂ²) insertion performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Clone Vulnerability] Since TelemetryEvent implements Clone, can an attacker trigger excessive cloning operations with large params maps causing performance degradation and memory pressure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Key Enumeration] Can an attacker probe for sensitive internal keys by submitting params with reserved or system key names, potentially revealing internal system state or configuration? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Value Injection] Do param values undergo proper sanitization, or can an attacker inject special characters (null bytes, newlines) causing log injection or parsing errors in downstream systems? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Encoding Attack] Can param values contain mixed character encodings (UTF-8, Latin-1) that cause deserialization inconsistencies or bypass validation checks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Duplicate Keys] Does serde's deserialization of params properly handle duplicate keys in JSON, or can an attacker override critical parameters by sending duplicate keys with different values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryEvent] [Null Byte Injection] Can params contain null bytes (\\x00) that truncate strings in C-based systems or cause unsafe behavior when interfacing with non-Rust code? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryDump] [Authentication Bypass] Can an attacker manipulate the `user_id` field to impersonate other validators or nodes, submitting telemetry data as different peers and polluting metrics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryDump] [Identity Spoofing] Does the `client_id` field undergo cryptographic verification, or can malicious actors forge client identities to submit false telemetry data affecting network monitoring? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryDump] [Timestamp Manipulation] Can an attacker submit `timestamp_micros` values far in the future or past, causing time-based logic errors, metric corruption, or bypassing rate limiting mechanisms? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryDump] [Integer Overflow] Does the `timestamp_micros` String undergo proper parsing validation, or can an attacker provide values exceeding u64::MAX causing integer overflow when converted to Duration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryDump] [Negative Timestamp] Can negative timestamp values be provided as strings, causing underflow or unexpected behavior when parsed into unsigned integers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryDump] [Event Array Bomb] Is there a limit on the `events` Vec size, or can an attacker submit dumps with millions of events causing memory exhaustion during deserialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryDump] [Empty Events Attack] Does downstream code properly handle TelemetryDump with empty events vectors, or could this cause panics or unexpected behavior in telemetry processing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryDump] [Client ID Format] Are there format restrictions on `client_id`, or can attackers use special formats (UUIDs, hex strings, arbitrary text) to bypass validation or correlation logic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryDump] [User ID Injection] Can the `user_id` field contain injection payloads that bypass PeerId validation or cause errors in identity verification systems? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: TelemetryDump] [Replay Attack] Without proper timestamp validation and nonce checking, can an attacker replay old TelemetryDump messages to skew metrics or trigger redundant processing? (Medium)
